description: Returns the metadata, structure, stages, and actions of a pipeline. Can be used to return the entire structure of a pipeline in JSON format, which can then be modified and used to update the pipeline structure with  UpdatePipeline.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the pipeline for which you want to get information. Pipeline names must be unique in an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the pipeline.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for CodePipeline to use to either perform actions with no actionRoleArn, or to use to assume roles for actions with an actionRoleArn.

nested_items.name: artifactStore
nested_items.description: Represents information about the S3 bucket where artifacts are stored for the pipeline.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the artifact store, such as S3.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket used for storing the artifacts for a pipeline. You can specify the name of an S3 bucket but not a folder in the bucket. A folder to contain the pipeline artifacts is created for you based on the name of the pipeline. You can use any S3 bucket in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the pipeline to store your pipeline artifacts.

nested_items.name: encryptionKey
nested_items.description: The encryption key used to encrypt the data in the artifact store, such as an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service key. If this is undefined, the default key for Amazon S3 is used.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID used to identify the key. For an Amazon Web Services KMS key, you can use the key ID, the key ARN, or the alias ARN.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of encryption key, such as an Amazon Web Services KMS key. When creating or updating a pipeline, the value must be set to --KMS'.

nested_items.name: artifactStores
nested_items.description: A mapping of artifactStore objects and their corresponding Amazon Web Services Regions. There must be an artifact store for the pipeline Region and for each cross-region action in the pipeline.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the artifact store, such as S3.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket used for storing the artifacts for a pipeline. You can specify the name of an S3 bucket but not a folder in the bucket. A folder to contain the pipeline artifacts is created for you based on the name of the pipeline. You can use any S3 bucket in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the pipeline to store your pipeline artifacts.

nested_items.name: encryptionKey
nested_items.description: The encryption key used to encrypt the data in the artifact store, such as an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service key. If this is undefined, the default key for Amazon S3 is used.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID used to identify the key. For an Amazon Web Services KMS key, you can use the key ID, the key ARN, or the alias ARN.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of encryption key, such as an Amazon Web Services KMS key. When creating or updating a pipeline, the value must be set to --KMS'.

nested_items.name: stages
nested_items.description: The stage in which to perform the action.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the stage.

nested_items.name: blockers
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions included in a stage.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The action declaration's name.

nested_items.name: actionTypeId
nested_items.description: Specifies the action type and the provider of the action.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the action. Valid categories are limited to one of the following values.
Source.
Build.
Test.
Deploy.
Invoke.
Approval.
Compute.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the action being called. There are three valid values for the Owner field in the action category section within your pipeline structure: AWS, ThirdParty, and Custom. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The provider of the service being called by the action. Valid providers are determined by the action category. For example, an action in the Deploy category type might have a provider of CodeDeploy, which would be specified as CodeDeploy. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the action version.

nested_items.name: runOrder
nested_items.description: The order in which actions are run.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: The action's configuration. These are key-value pairs that specify input values for an action. For more information, see Action Structure Requirements in CodePipeline. For the list of configuration properties for the CloudFormation action type in CodePipeline, see Configuration Properties Reference in the CloudFormation User Guide. For template snippets with examples, see Using Parameter Override Functions with CodePipeline Pipelines in the CloudFormation User Guide.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: commands
nested_items.description: The shell commands to run with your compute action in CodePipeline. All commands are supported except multi-line formats. While CodeBuild logs and permissions are used, you do not need to create any resources in CodeBuild.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: outputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The name or ID of the result of the action declaration, such as a test or build artifact.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the output of an artifact, such as 'My App'.

nested_items.name: files
nested_items.description: The files that you want to associate with the output artifact that will be exported from the compute action.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The name or ID of the artifact consumed by the action, such as a test or build artifact.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the artifact to be worked on (for example, 'My App').

nested_items.name: outputVariables
nested_items.description: The list of variables that are to be exported from the compute action. This is specifically CodeBuild environment variables as used for that action.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM service role that performs the declared action. This is assumed through the roleArn for the pipeline.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The action declaration's Amazon Web Services Region, such as us-east-1.

nested_items.name: namespace
nested_items.description: The variable namespace associated with the action. All variables produced as output by this action fall under this namespace.

nested_items.name: timeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: A timeout duration in minutes that can be applied against the ActionType's default timeout value specified in Quotas for CodePipeline. This attribute is available only to the manual approval ActionType.

nested_items.name: environmentVariables
nested_items.description: The environment variables for the action.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The environment variable name in the key-value pair.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The environment variable value in the key-value pair.

nested_items.name: onFailure
nested_items.description: The method to use when a stage has not completed successfully. For example, configuring this field for rollback will roll back a failed stage automatically to the last successful pipeline execution in the stage.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: The specified result for when the failure conditions are met, such as rolling back the stage.

nested_items.name: retryConfiguration
nested_items.description: The retry configuration specifies automatic retry for a failed stage, along with the configured retry mode.

nested_items.name: retryMode
nested_items.description: The method that you want to configure for automatic stage retry on stage failure. You can specify to retry only failed action in the stage or all actions in the stage.

nested_items.name: conditions
nested_items.description: The conditions that are configured as failure conditions. For more information about conditions, see Stage conditions and How do stage conditions work?.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: The action to be done when the condition is met. For example, rolling back an execution for a failure condition.

nested_items.name: rules
nested_items.description: The rules that make up the condition.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the rule that is created for the condition, such as VariableCheck.

nested_items.name: ruleTypeId
nested_items.description: The ID for the rule type, which is made up of the combined values for category, owner, provider, and version.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of rule can be run in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the rule. The valid category is Rule.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the rule being called. The valid value for the Owner field in the rule category is AWS.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The rule provider, such as the DeploymentWindow rule. For a list of rule provider names, see the rules listed in the CodePipeline rule reference.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the rule version.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: The action configuration fields for the rule.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: commands
nested_items.description: The shell commands to run with your commands rule in CodePipeline. All commands are supported except multi-line formats. While CodeBuild logs and permissions are used, you do not need to create any resources in CodeBuild.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The input artifacts fields for the rule, such as specifying an input file for the rule.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the artifact to be worked on (for example, 'My App').

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The pipeline role ARN associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Region for the condition associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: timeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: The action timeout for the rule.

nested_items.name: onSuccess
nested_items.description: The method to use when a stage has succeeded. For example, configuring this field for conditions will allow the stage to succeed when the conditions are met.

nested_items.name: conditions
nested_items.description: The conditions that are success conditions.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: The action to be done when the condition is met. For example, rolling back an execution for a failure condition.

nested_items.name: rules
nested_items.description: The rules that make up the condition.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the rule that is created for the condition, such as VariableCheck.

nested_items.name: ruleTypeId
nested_items.description: The ID for the rule type, which is made up of the combined values for category, owner, provider, and version.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of rule can be run in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the rule. The valid category is Rule.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the rule being called. The valid value for the Owner field in the rule category is AWS.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The rule provider, such as the DeploymentWindow rule. For a list of rule provider names, see the rules listed in the CodePipeline rule reference.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the rule version.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: The action configuration fields for the rule.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: commands
nested_items.description: The shell commands to run with your commands rule in CodePipeline. All commands are supported except multi-line formats. While CodeBuild logs and permissions are used, you do not need to create any resources in CodeBuild.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The input artifacts fields for the rule, such as specifying an input file for the rule.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the artifact to be worked on (for example, 'My App').

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The pipeline role ARN associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Region for the condition associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: timeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: The action timeout for the rule.

nested_items.name: beforeEntry
nested_items.description: The method to use when a stage allows entry. For example, configuring this field for conditions will allow entry to the stage when the conditions are met.

nested_items.name: conditions
nested_items.description: The conditions that are configured as entry conditions.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: The action to be done when the condition is met. For example, rolling back an execution for a failure condition.

nested_items.name: rules
nested_items.description: The rules that make up the condition.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the rule that is created for the condition, such as VariableCheck.

nested_items.name: ruleTypeId
nested_items.description: The ID for the rule type, which is made up of the combined values for category, owner, provider, and version.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of rule can be run in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the rule. The valid category is Rule.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the rule being called. The valid value for the Owner field in the rule category is AWS.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The rule provider, such as the DeploymentWindow rule. For a list of rule provider names, see the rules listed in the CodePipeline rule reference.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the rule version.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: The action configuration fields for the rule.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: commands
nested_items.description: The shell commands to run with your commands rule in CodePipeline. All commands are supported except multi-line formats. While CodeBuild logs and permissions are used, you do not need to create any resources in CodeBuild.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inputArtifacts
nested_items.description: The input artifacts fields for the rule, such as specifying an input file for the rule.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the artifact to be worked on (for example, 'My App').

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The pipeline role ARN associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Region for the condition associated with the rule.

nested_items.name: timeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: The action timeout for the rule.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version number of the pipeline. A new pipeline always has a version number of 1. This number is incremented when a pipeline is updated.

nested_items.name: executionMode
nested_items.description: The method that the pipeline will use to handle multiple executions. The default mode is SUPERSEDED.

nested_items.name: pipelineType
nested_items.description: CodePipeline provides the following pipeline types, which differ in characteristics and price, so that you can tailor your pipeline features and cost to the needs of your applications.
V1 type pipelines have a JSON structure that contains standard pipeline, stage, and action-level parameters.
V2 type pipelines have the same structure as a V1 type, along with additional parameters for release safety and trigger configuration.

nested_items.name: variables
nested_items.description: A list that defines the pipeline variables for a pipeline resource. Variable names can have alphanumeric and underscore characters, and the values must match [A-Za-z0-9@\-_]+.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of a pipeline-level variable.

nested_items.name: defaultValue
nested_items.description: The value of a pipeline-level variable.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of a pipeline-level variable. It's used to add additional context about the variable, and not being used at time when pipeline executes.

nested_items.name: triggers
nested_items.description: The trigger configuration specifying a type of event, such as Git tags, that starts the pipeline.

nested_items.name: providerType
nested_items.description: The source provider for the event, such as connections configured for a repository with Git tags, for the specified trigger configuration.

nested_items.name: gitConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides the filter criteria and the source stage for the repository event that starts the pipeline, such as Git tags.

nested_items.name: sourceActionName
nested_items.description: The name of the pipeline source action where the trigger configuration, such as Git tags, is specified. The trigger configuration will start the pipeline upon the specified change only.

nested_items.name: push
nested_items.description: The field where the repository event that will start the pipeline, such as pushing Git tags, is specified with details.

nested_items.name: includes
nested_items.description: The list of patterns of Git tags that, when pushed, are to be included as criteria that starts the pipeline.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: excludes
nested_items.description: The list of patterns of Git tags that, when pushed, are to be excluded from starting the pipeline.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: includes
nested_items.description: The list of patterns of Git branches that, when a commit is pushed, are to be included as criteria that starts the pipeline.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: excludes
nested_items.description: The list of patterns of Git branches that, when a commit is pushed, are to be excluded from starting the pipeline.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: filePaths
nested_items.description: The field that specifies to filter on file paths for the push trigger configuration.

nested_items.name: includes
nested_items.description: The list of patterns of Git repository file paths that, when a commit is pushed, are to be included as criteria that starts the pipeline.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: excludes
nested_items.description: The list of patterns of Git repository file paths that, when a commit is pushed, are to be excluded from starting the pipeline.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: pullRequest
nested_items.description: The field where the repository event that will start the pipeline is specified as pull requests.
CLOSED.
OPEN.
UPDATED.

nested_items.name: pipelineArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.

nested_items.name: created
nested_items.description: The date and time the pipeline was created, in timestamp format.

nested_items.name: updated
nested_items.description: The date and time the pipeline was last updated, in timestamp format.

nested_items.name: pollingDisabledAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that polling for source changes (periodic checks) was stopped for the pipeline, in timestamp format. You can migrate (update) a polling pipeline to use event-based change detection. For example, for a pipeline with a CodeCommit source, we recommend you migrate (update) your pipeline to use CloudWatch Events. To learn more, see Migrate polling pipelines to use event-based change detection in the CodePipeline User Guide.
